title: DEM Simulation
description: Specification of a Discrete Elemet Method (DEM) simulation
title: Discrete element method data format specification

fileFormat.description: Name of data format; always demdf
fileFormat.use: Intended for verification of the validity of the file

fileFormatVersion.description: Version of the DEMDF specification being used
fileFormatVersion.use: Format names and structure will change, so knowing the version being read becomes neccessary

name.use: The name of the simulation should serve as a human readable reference to the specific simulation. It should not be used for the generation of directories, as simulations could consist of several directories, and a general name is more flexible than directory names

dimensionality.description: Number of spatial degrees of freedom of particles

time.description: Current time (in arbitrary units) of the simulation

timeEnd.description: Time (in arbitrary units) at which the simulation should stop

timeStep.description: For soft-simulations, the time-step of integration of the forces

timeStepCount.description: How many time-steps have been realized since the beginning of the simlation

timeStepCountEnd.description: Number of time-steps at which the simulation should stop

eventCount.description: How many events have been processed since the beginning of an event-driven simulation

eventCountEnd.description: Number of events at which the simulation should stop

output.description: Object containing the list of output routines, such as measurements and including demdf files

domain.description: Two D-vectors specifying the opposite vertices of a square that defines the system's domain
domain.use: The domain defines the region in space where objects are allowed to be. Any object outside the domain should result in a error. This can be used for the generation of grids or the inclusion or periodic boundary conditions, etc.

bodyForce.longDescription: It should be specified as a D-vector which results a in a force in simulational units being applied to all objects

objectTypes.description: An array of objects specifying the properties of each type of object.
objectTypes.longDescription: Object types exist to reduce the amount of data saved on the particle list, as all particle properties (with the exception of position and velocity, stored in the 'particles' list) can be stored in an objectType and thus only referenced by the objectType id.
objectTypes.use: Every particle should have an objectType identifier, and the corresponding properties stored by the objectType. For example, the radius of particle [0.1, 0.5, 0.3, 8.1, 2.3, 5.1, 10] is stored in the objectType 10.

objects.description: Object of objects, containing the lists of walls and particles.

particles.description: List of arrays with particles' position, velocity and type
particles.longDescription: Data should be of the form [[x-position, y-position, z-position, x-velocity, y-velocity, z-velocity, type], ...], with the amount of coordinates actually depending on the dimensionality.

interactions.description: Array of objects, each object containing the description of the interaction between the different objectTypes
